title: Automation Shines at First Solar | ASSEMBLY - Assembly Magazine
summary: First Solar is investing in U.S. manufacturing of photovoltaic modules to meet the growing demand for domestic solar products, despite competition from Chinese manufacturers who benefit from government subsidies. First Solar's factory in Ohio produces modules in just four and a half hours, using a continuous process that is more efficient and environmentally friendly than the batch processes used by competitors. First Solar is committed to responsible solar, producing modules with a low carbon footprint and a high recycling rate.
green_innovation: TRUE. First Solar's photovoltaic modules are designed and manufactured to minimize environmental impact throughout their life cycle, making them a green innovation.
business_innovation: TRUE. First Solar's factory in Ohio uses a continuous process and Industry 4.0 architecture to produce solar panels with a higher degree of automation, precision, and continuous improvement, making it a business innovation.
green_product: TRUE. First Solar's photovoltaic modules are green products because they are designed, manufactured, and used in a way that significantly reduces their environmental impact throughout their life cycle.
green_process: TRUE. First Solar's continuous manufacturing process is a green process because it minimizes environmental impacts and promotes sustainability by reducing waste, conserving natural resources, decreasing energy consumption, and limiting the release of harmful substances into the environment.
likely_naics_codes: ['335999 (All Other Miscellaneous Electrical Equipment and Component Manufacturing)', '334413 (Semiconductor and Related Device Manufacturing)', '321999 (All Other Miscellaneous Chemical Product and Preparation Manufacturing)', '562991 (Packaging and Labeling Services)']
greenwashing: FALSE. First Solar's photovoltaic modules and manufacturing processes are not examples of greenwashing because they are genuinely environmentally friendly.

title: SCIO briefing on development of industry and information technology in 2022 - Official website of the State Council Information Office of China
summary: The Chinese government has set ambitious goals for the development of green and smart technologies, with the goal of achieving carbon neutrality by 2060. In 2022, the Chinese government implemented a series of policies and measures to promote the development of the green and smart technology sector, including providing financial support for research and development, encouraging the adoption of green technologies by businesses, and investing in the construction of smart cities.
company: Ministry of Industry and Information Technology (MIIT)
official_company_name: Ministry of Industry and Information Technology of the People's Republic of China
product_or_process: C919 large passenger aircraft, extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO), industrial internet

title: How Technology is Facilitating Comfort in Your Footwear - Indian Retailer
summary: Various beauty and personal care companies in India discuss their 2022 achievements and 2023 growth plans. Some of these companies are expanding into new markets, launching new products, and investing in research and development. The article also discusses the importance of sustainability for these companies.
